user.biography:
Artist, NatGeo Fellow, photographer and filmmaker. Professional speaker. Environmentalist. 
Artist duo Alexandrov Klum

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mattias A. Klum on August 30, 2021 tagging @mattiasklumofficial, and @alexandrovklumofficial. May be an image of nature and body of water.

node.text: When people ask me about favorite places to photograph I find it nearly impossible to answer. I honestly think almost any place has remarkable shots to be taken and great and important stories to be told. In this flow many places and stories are represented, from near and far. I took this particular photograph in Iceland. #artistduoalexandrovklum #iceland #photography @irisalexandrov @natgeo @alexandrovklumofficial

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mattias A. Klum on August 25, 2021 tagging @natgeo, @mattiasklumofficial, and @alexandrovklumofficial. May be a closeup of flower and nature.

node.text:
A major throwback! Shot this lesser spider hunter pollinating a wild banana related species on reversal film in the incredible rainforest of Danum Valley, Sabah, Malaysian Borneo 1995. Love the magical light filtered through the canopy high above down into the dusky understory.... Shot on assignment for @natgeo
Please check out our current art projects @alexandrovklumofficial #alexandrovklumofficial #borneo #danumvalley #protectbiodiversity @natgeo @irisalexandrov

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mattias A. Klum on August 19, 2021 tagging @mattiasklumofficial. May be an image of animal.

node.text:
Today is #worldorangutanday and as an orphaned baby orangutan sleeps peacefully at a rescue centre in Central Kalimantan, Indonesia, thousands of orangutans are also  cared for by hard working, compassionate people trying to give this endangered species a second chance. I have a great job, people tell me. I get to see the most incredible places on this planet. I get close to fascinating species of all kinds. But I obviously get to see the flip-side of the coin... I get to experience destruction, climate change and horrors first hand. What truly gives me hope is meeting and working with people commited to helping people and nature. People all over world doing amazing things to secure a better future. The orangutan is Asia’s only great ape. Orangutans only live on the islands of Borneo and Sumatra. Today, both Sumatran and Borneo orangutans are threatened by extinction. 
Laws and regulations alone are clearly insufficient to protect this unique species. Orangutan conservation requires comprehensive and integrated efforts by all stakeholders, both in the field and in the political arena, to ensure its success. Please help protect the orangutan and the rainforest! Support organizations like WWF or BOS and by sharing this message! Shot on assignment for @natgeo. #BOS #helpsave #iucn #redapes #borneo #mattiasklum #orangutan #conservation  #savetherainforest #protectbiodiversity @thephotosociety @irisalexandrov @natgeo @alexandrovklumofficial

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mattias A. Klum on August 12, 2021 tagging @mattiasklumofficial, and @alexandrovklumofficial. May be an image of elephant and nature.

node.text: Today I commemorate the #worlelephantday by showing these elephants quenching their thirst near Abu Camp, Botswana. Here they are relatively safe but more than 100 000 elephants have been killed in Africa the last 3 years! In fact roughly every 15 minutes an elephant is killed for its tusks and most countries in Africa don't have adequate capacity to protect their herds. Please help elephant conservation and support organizations like @wwf @tpw_foundation and the #peaceparkfoundation #elephant #africa #botswana  #peaceparks #iucn #conservation  #elephants #africa #stoppoaching #mattiasklum @natgeo @wwf @thephotosociety  @irisalexandrov @alexandrovklumofficial

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mattias A. Klum on August 10, 2021 tagging @mattiasklumofficial, and @alexandrovklumofficial. May be an image of big cat and nature.

node.text:
Today is #worldlionday!
After weeks of tracking the asiatic lions on foot, I managed to sneak up on this mating couple (without interupting their activity). Most people think of lions as strictly African predators, but only because they’ve been killed off almost everywhere else. 
Ten thousand years ago lions spanned vast sections of the globe, and so did people and as we multiplied and got organized we put tremendous pressure on competitors at the top of the food chain. Now lions hold only a small fraction of their former habitat, and Asiatic lions, a subspecies that split from African lions perhaps 100,000 years ago, hang on to an almost impossibly small slice of their former domain.  Shot on assignment for @natgeo 
Go to @alexandrovklumofficial to check out our new art project in collaboration with @voguescandinavia 
#asiaticlion #protectbiodiversity #girforest #india #throwback #saveourlions #artistduoalexandrovklum @natgeo  @thephotosociety @@irisalexandrov @alexandrovklumofficial @natgeotravel

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mattias A. Klum on August 08, 2021 tagging @gretathunberg, @alexandrovklumofficial, and @voguescandinavia. May be an image of 2 people, outdoors and text.

node.text:
We @alexandrovklumofficial are proud to contribute to the cover of the very first #1 Vogue Scandinavia issue! Our work together with @gretathunberg and @voguescandinavia was created with the intention to create a modern fairy tale with the intention of connecting human and nature and raise awareness for our natural world and the huge pressure we put on the eco systems. 
Read more about the project and the interview, fashion story and articles on @voguescandinavia (link in profile).
#artistduoalexandrovklum 
#voguescandinavia @mattiasklumofficial @irisalexandrov

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mattias A. Klum on August 05, 2021 tagging @mattiasklumofficial, and @alexandrovklumofficial. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text:
While diving or snorkeling in the Galapagos you can easily bumb in to marine iguanas like this one. The marine iguana can be found only on the Galápagos Islands and it has the ability, unique among modern lizards, to forage in the sea, making it a marine reptile. The marine iguanas are sometimes dangerously cold after grazing algae at dephts down to nearly 10 meters (30 or more feet). Shot on assignment for @natgeo 
Please check out @alexandrovklumofficial to learn more about our current art projects and our upcoming road trip in Sweden.  #galapagos #cool #cold #mattiasklum #marineiguana #conservation #protectouroceans #protectbiodiversity @natgeo @thephotosociety @irisalexandrov @alexandrovklumofficial

node.text: We are so excited to go on a @alexandrovklumofficial road trip in lovely Sweden. Working on new exhibitions and art shows,  visiting new venues and of course some friends along the way! #protectbiodiversity #artistduoalexandrovklum #ceroemissionsroadtrip #eqc #mbfamily #sweden #art @irisalexandrov @swedense @alexandrovklumofficial

node.text: Love the camouflage and the gorgeous eyes of this funky creature! I photographed this crocodile fish during a night dive in Raja Ampat, an archipelago off the northwestern tip of West Papua,  Indonesia. One of the richest marine ecosystems on Earth. #rajaampat #saveouroceans #conservation #protectbiodiversity #goldentriangle @natgeo @alexandrovklumofficial @irisalexandrov @thephotosociety

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mattias A. Klum on July 16, 2021 tagging @mattiasklumofficial. May be an image of snake and nature.

node.text:
An African Tree viper (Atheris sp.) will here represent snakes near and far because today is #worldsnakeday !!! As pretty as they come, this nocturnal arboreal viper feeds on frogs, lizards, birds etc. The fact that it's a viper means that it has a long mobile fang that can swing forward when the snake strikes. I took this photograph in the beautiful rainforest of Nouabal-Ndoki National Park in the Republic of the Congo for @natgeo 
Please check out @alexandrovklumofficial to learn about our art projects! #republicofthecongo #protectbiodiversity #mattiasklum #livingthedream #ndoki #artistduoalexandrovklum @irisalexandrov @alexandrovklumofficial @thephotosociety @natgeo

node.text: Today it’s #sharkawarenessday !  I’m honoring this by reposting a sequence from our film Vamizi -Cradle of Coral.  A beautiful pack of gray reef sharks on the prowl on Neptune's Arm,  near Vamizi, the largest island in the Quirimbas Archipelago. Its relative isolation from mainland Mozambique has preserved Vamizi’s natural beauty and wildlife. It has magnificent coral reefs and is a unique breeding ground for whales, dolphins, turtles and and not least the endangered gray reef sharks. Please go to @alexandrovklumofficial to see other images from Vamizi and to learn more about our international projects! #friendsofvamizi #vamizi #artistduoalexandrovklum #vamiziisland #oceanconservation #protectbiodiversity @natgeo @irisalexandrov @alexandrovklumofficial

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Mattias A. Klum on July 12, 2021 tagging @mattiasklumofficial. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
The beautiful textile cone snail is one of the most venomous creatures on the planet. Several human deaths have been attributed to this species. Their venom, a complex concoction of hundreds of different toxins, is delivered via a harpoonlike tooth propelled from an extendable proboscis (seen vaguely in this picture). There is no antivenin for a cone snail sting, and treatment is limited to merely keeping victims alive until the toxins wear off.
Just because human deaths are fairly uncommon, it doesn't mean you shouldn’t be cautious. A few microliters of cone snail toxin is powerful enough to kill a bunch of people.
The incredibly toxic venom of this species has to be strong enough to instantly paralyze. Otherwise, the lunch would swim away to die, and the slow-moving snail would end up with nothing. 
Ironically, among the compounds found in cone snail venom are proteins which, when isolated, have enormous potential as pain-killing drugs. Research shows that certain of these proteins target specific human pain receptors and can be up to 10,000 times more potent than morphine without morphine 's addictive properties and side-effects. #lovescience #conesnail #protectbiodiversity #fiji #mattiasaklum @natgeo @thephotosociety @irisalexandrov @alexandrovklumofficial
